Murder On 
      Lockhart Road 
Saturday, June 16, at 9 
      p.m. ET/PT

 
On Sept. 28, 2000, former 
      Indiana state trooper David Camm says he came home and found his 
      35-year-old wife Kim, and his five-year-old daughter Jill murdered, both 
      shot execution-style in the head; his seven-year old-son Brad died after 
      being shot in the chest. 
 
Three days later, Camm was 
      charged with the murders. He has always denied any 
      involvement.
 
Eleven eyewitnesses say Camm was with 
      them. There are bizarre clues, too, 
      including a sweatshirt with someone else’s DNA. And did the killer have a 
      foot fetish?
 
Correspondent Richard 
      Schlesinger has spent more than five years investigating the 
      case, with countless twists and turns, and an ending no one 
      expected.
 
Schlesinger reports for 48 Hours 
      Mystery, this Saturday at a special time, 9 p.m. 
      ET/PT.
 
Watch
Schlesinger's 
      reporter's notebook.
